brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate whether nocturnal breathing and sleep of patients
      with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) are disturbed during a stay at moderate
      altitude.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nocturnal Breathing and Sleep in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Staying at Altitude

detailed_description.textblock:
This randomized cross-over trial evaluates the hypothesis that patients with chronic
      obstructive pulmonary disease experience nocturnal hypoxemia, periodic breathing and sleep
      disturbances when staying at moderate altitude. Sleep studies and clinical evaluations will
      be performed during 2 days in Zurich (490 m, low altitude baseline) and during 2 days at
      Davos Clavadel (1650 m), and 2 days at Davos Jakobshorn (2590 m).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), GOLD grade 2-3

          -  residents at low altitude (<800 m)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Unstable condition, COPD exacerbation

          -  Mild (GOLD 1) or very severe COPD (GOLD 4)

          -  requirement for oxygen therapy at low altitude residence

          -  hypoventilation

          -  pulmonary hypertension

          -  more than mild or unstable cardiovascular disease

          -  use of drugs that affect respiratory center drive

          -  internal, neurologic or psychiatric disease that interfere with protocol compliance
             including current heavy smoking (>20 cigarettes per day), inability to perform 6 min
             walk test.

          -  previous intolerance to moderate altitude (<2600m).

          -  Exposure to altitudes >1500m for >2 days within the last 4 weeks before the study.

          -  Pregnant or nursing patients

clinical_study.official_title: Nocturnal Breathing and Sleep in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Staying at Altitude

primary_outcome.description: mean nocturnal oxygen saturation measured by pulse oximetry
primary_outcome.measure: Change in mean nocturnal oxygen saturation from baseline measured at 490 m
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in mean nocturnal oxygen saturation from 490 m baseline during 2 days at 2590 m

primary_outcome.measure: Change in apnea/hypopnea index from baseline measured at 490 m
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in apnea/hypopnea index from 490 m baseline during 2 days at 2590 m

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mean nocturnal oxygen saturation from baseline measured at 490 m
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in mean nocturnal oxygen saturation from 490 m baseline during 2 days at 1650 m

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in apnea/hypopnea index from baseline measured at 490 m
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in apnea/hypopnea index from 490 m baseline during stay at 1650 m

secondary_outcome.description: Visual analog scale of sleep quality
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in subjective sleep quality from baseline measured at 490 m
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in subjective sleep quality from 490 m during 2 days at 2590 m

secondary_outcome.description: Visual analog scale of sleep quality
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in subjective sleep quality from baseline measured at 490 m
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in subjective sleep quality from 490 m baseline during 2 days at 1650 m

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in reaction time from baseline measured at 490 m
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in reaction time from 490 m baseline during 2 days at 2590 m

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in reaction time from baseline measured at 490 m
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in reaction time from 490 m baseline during 2 days at 1650 m

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label
